question.title: Getting No enum constant error while trying to map an entity to DTO( In API spec ,property is enum
question.body:
API Specs as below:

type: object
properties:
  vasOrPlan:
    type: string
    enum:
      - "VAS"
      - "plan"
      - "Both"
  moduleOrApp:
    type: string
    enum:
      - "module"
      - "app"

Function Used to map value from Entity To DTO as below:

default List<Answers> mapEntityToAnswerDto(
    List<RecommPlanAnswerEntity> recommPlanAnswerEntities) {
    return recommPlanAnswerEntities.stream()
        .map(recommPlanAnswerEntity
            -> Answers.builder()
                   .vasOrPlan(Answers.VasOrPlanEnum.valueOf(
                       recommPlanAnswerEntity
                           .getRecommPlanAnswerFeatureMapping()
                           .getVasOrPlan()))
                   .moduleOrApp(Answers.ModuleOrAppEnum.valueOf(
                       recommPlanAnswerEntity
                           .getRecommPlanAnswerFeatureMapping()
                           .getModuleOrApp()))
                   .build())
        .toList();
}

Entity as below:

@Column(name = "vas_or_plan", nullable = false)
private String vasOrPlan;

@Column(name = "module_or_app")
private String moduleOrApp;

Can someone please help how to map a string to ENUM (In DTO/Spec it is mentioned as ENUM) Response Error Message:

{
  "statusCode": 400,
  "timestamp": [
    2025,
    5,
    24,
    10,
    24,
    29,
    525508783
  ],
  "message": "No enum constant com.clover.api.webonboarding.server.Answers.VasOrPlanEnum.plan",
  "description": "uri=/webonboarding/v1/adminClaimFlow/question/1",
  "status": {
    "reason": "No enum constant com.clover.api.webonboarding.server.Answers.VasOrPlanEnum.plan",
    "code": 400
  }
}

answers.body:
It resolved via use of uppercase as below:

Answers.builder()
                   .vasOrPlan(Answers.VasOrPlanEnum.valueOf(
                       recommPlanAnswerEntity
                           .getRecommPlanAnswerFeatureMapping()
                           .getVasOrPlan().toUpperCase))

question_comments.body: @Abra I already use Answers.VasOrPlanEnum.valueOf in the function
@TevinS  recommPlanAnswerEntity.getRecommPlanAnswerFeatureMapping().g‌​etVasOrPlan() is populating as "Both" which is a value that matches the constant.
Maybe you need method valueOf ?
